title: Citi Czech Republic Survey: Nearly 60 Percent of SME Companies from Emerging Europe Plan International Expansion
summary: Prague - Results from the annual Citi mid-market survey in Central and Eastern Europe & the Middle East showed that regionally, approximately 58 percent of mid-market companies polled plan to expand their businesses internationally within this year - while more than a third (37 percent) of smaller companies surveyed expect to do the same.
tag-1: Citi Czech Republic Survey: Nearly 60 Percent of SME Companies from Emerging Europe Plan International Expansion
tag-3: Prague – Results from the annual Citi mid-market survey in Central and Eastern Europe & the Middle East showed that regionally, approximately 58 percent of mid-market companies polled plan to expand their businesses internationally within this year – while more than a third (37 percent) of smaller companies surveyed expect to do the same.
tag-4: "Confidence is increasing for the majority of companies we polled. They will increasingly look beyond their national borders for growth," said Tasnim Ghiawadwala, Head of Citi Commercial Bank, Europe, Middle East & Africa. "The most popular places for expansion are the Middle East and within Europe."
tag-5: Expansion of Czech companies and the most common challenges
tag-6: "We're pleased to say that 49 percent of SME [small and medium enterprise] companies we surveyed in the Czech Republic have international expansion plans, which they see as a means of growing their businesses," said Daniel Krumpolc, Head of Commercial banking, Citi Czech Republic. "We feel this reflects well on the Czech Republic and the top industries where we expect expansion."
tag-7: In the Czech Republic, these top industries include manufacturing (47 percent), consumer goods (24 percent) and information technologies (10 percent).
tag-8: Among the most common challenges for mid-market companies around the region are: achieving sales growth or dealing with a sales decline, international expansion, changing economic environment and managing working capital
tag-11: 83 percent of the 1,416 respondents are senior financial executives, while 61 percent of those are CEOs, CFOs or managing partners from companies based in Bahrain, Czech Republic, Hungary, Jordan, Poland, Romania, Russia, Turkey and the UAE.
tag-12: Respondents had average annual overall revenue of US$44 million. 73 percent of companies polled have up to US$35 million in revenue while 27 percent generated revenue well above that amount.
